context: A high-severity human-operated ransomware attack was launched from a compromised asset. The incident, which occurred from 2024-06-20 to 2024-06-20, was flagged by multiple security products. It involved 71 alerts and various tactics and techniques. System recovery setting tampering was observed on a host named `vnevado-win10s`. Native Windows utilities like `vssblatemp.exe` and `bcdedit.exe` were used to disable or delete system recovery features, possibly to prevent recovering a corrupted system. This is indicative of an adversary attempting to augment the effects of data destruction or encryption. Many native Windows utilities have been used by adversaries to disable or delete system recovery features: • vssblatemp.exe can be used to delete all volume shadow copies on a system using the following command: [vssblatemp.exe delete shadows /all /quiet] • Windows Management Instrumentation can be used to delete volume shadow copies using the following command: [wmic shadowcopy delete] • wbblatemp.exe can be used to delete the Windows Backup Catalog using the following command: [wbblatemp.exe delete catalog -quiet] • bcdedit.exe can be used to disable automatic Windows recovery features by modifying boot configuration data using the following command: [bcdedit.exe /set default bootstatuspolicy ignoreallfailures & bcdedit /set default recoveryenabled no]
